website_summaries.verdict: The AOC G2460PQU is a well-equipped 24-inch gaming monitor with a 144Hz refresh rate and a speedy pixel response.
pros: Speedy pixel response and refresh rate

website_summaries.verdict: The AOC G2460PF is a well-priced, well-equipped 24-inch monitor with good gaming chops, though its gray-scale and viewing-angle performance could be better.

customer_reviews.title: This screen is good.
customer_reviews.text: No problem so far. This screen is good. Edit: PLEASE READ THIS Still 5 stars but I wish I knew it before! If you want freesync to work over 60 fps (and have a vsync at 75hz) you have to install the beta driver of the screen (and start windows in test mod to allow unsigned drivers)!
customer_reviews.author: Charles and Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good monitor at this price
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected for this price. I bought it as a monitor for a Raspberry Pi. Controls a bit fiddly, but no more than most monitors. Blacks could be blacker, but acceptable after a little tweaking. Came with HDMI, VGA, DP and audio cables, which was a pleasant surprise. The stand is reasonably sturdy. Extra marks for an integrated PSU with kettle lead rather than an external transformer/wall wart.
customer_reviews.author: HYWEL and LINDA THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great picture quality, crisp and clear. Stylish and easy set up. Worked straight out of the box. Good size. I use it as an additional screen for my laptop. I do graphic design and video editing and the work space on this monitor is perfect. I keep it in the box and bring it out when I need it, clips into the stand easily and securely. Hopefully will save up and get my son one too. He's a gaming YouTuber and he's tried this monitor on his set up and loves it. Very happy. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Darron W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I had brought this monitor off a recommendation from an E-Sports player and I must say it's very good, especially when considering the price. I've had it for 2 months and will be buying the 27" version as my second monitor while keeping the 24" for my main gaming monitor. I mainly play FPS games like Siege and it has gaming modes for Racing, FPS and many more. These basically just change the colour grading to make the perfect gaming experience. The 144hz and 1ms response really make a difference for me especially been as I am a semi-pro. Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it! I've been playing computer games since the ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! I've been playing computer games since the early\mid eighties. The first ever monitor I owned was a green screen Amstrad one! I've had a fair few since over the years and I can honestly say this is by far the best I've owned. The clarity is amazing. I had a BenQ 24 inch 60hz before this and I can't believe the difference! Not just in 3D games but 2D aswell! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Rimmer

customer_reviews.title: Impossible
customer_reviews.text: Three hours after delivery to sort out the brightness and colours and still not right, if you can not setup 100% it makes picture/games look bad even Nvidia control panel does nothing When you open web pages you get a yellow tint and even scouting forums and youtube for a setup guide its still no good, i will give it 72 hours then i return it as a loss cause unless someone or AOC can solve this problem
customer_reviews.author: Baldnold

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic monitor for home working
customer_reviews.text: Was really impressed by this monitor. Some people have said it is too bright. I didn’t think so and there is an option to turn this down in any case. Worked straight out the box and took maybe under 10 minutes to set up. Really was hassle free. Bought as a higher resolution monitor now that I’m working from home and serves that purpose extremely well. Can read text with utmost clarity and doesn’t give me a headache or eye strain like my low resolution TV did. The difference between those two is huge and suddenly makes my job a whole lot easier. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Nicky Jenkin - njenkin

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for but it's still definitely a good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a good monitor. The high refresh rate and FreeSync capabilities are great features that really make this display a good one. Because it's a TN panel, and a cheap one as well, the colour isn't particularly accurate as you can see in the photo above (both calibrated to 5000K with a Spyder4, Dell P2217H vs this product), but for gaming this isn't particularly important. Overall a great purchase if you don't mind sacrificing a small amount of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Poulton

customer_reviews.title: I personally love the red strip underneath the bottom bezzel which is ...
customer_reviews.text: Grate display despite it being a TN panel. AMD Freesync as you’d expect works flawlessly. I personally love the red strip underneath the bottom bezzel which is a nod to its included Freesync feature. AOC does this also for the nvidia gsync version which rather then a red strip, includes a green strip of course representing nvidia. My model came with a stuck pixel however at this price point, really didn’t bother me as its hardly noticeable due to the size of the display. Over all, if you have a AMD graphics card and are looking for a cheap decent quality monitor then I’d highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: The only regret I have in my build. picture quality is just ok, my old dell monitor had better image quality then this. Freesync works when it wants to, sometimes doesn't turn on after the computer goes to sleep. Stand is useless, I ended up getting a vesa mount. But for the price I paid (£81), I can't really complain, it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Mvelo

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Would be 5 stars if the monitor wasnt locked on 60Hz and asvertized as 75Hz. Expect the colours to be too warm in "out of teh box" settings. I understand that you put warm light so ppl have easier time sleeping after long evening sessions of gaming, but holy cow, making a screen literaly oragne is not the way to go! Its easily fixable in the settings (using buttons on the monitor). Putting Hz up to advertized digits is another story. Thats why 1 star deduction. It is doable, follow other ppls instructions in their reviews. Good luck! Still happy with the purchase! I will probably buy a second one when Im bored with just one screen
customer_reviews.author: Agnieszka

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: The 144Hz is good but the picture quality is just so bad I've gone back to my old Samsung 60Hz monitor from 2009 after less than a day of using it. Too bad it was a Christmas present now I can't get my money back. Its truly an I genius move by a company to not let you edit sharpness settings because they believe they have the perfect preset one. Brightness and Dynamic range are both God Awful. Hopefully I can get my money back but its looking unlikely :(
customer_reviews.author: Sean Burke

customer_reviews.title: Great picture and functionality
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this monitor from another that I was really disappointed with. I chose AOC after doing some research. The brightness, contrast, response and definition are all great. The monitor menu options and ability to control various aspects of the picture are far better than the other monitors I've used. Highly recommended. Also nice is that the monitor included HDMI and DisplayPort cables. My graphics has DisplayPort connectore. which are not that common.
customer_reviews.author: Gabi

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for I guess
customer_reviews.text: Monitor purchased to enhance my gaming and a secondary monitor for work (My biggest mistake) The brightness/ contrast is a nightmare - either too bright or too dark. Tried so many solutions. Had to install non certified drivers (from AOC) which were a pain to install. For work, documents/ text, it's garbage. If I could go back in time and not buy this monitor! I would and be £90 better off. Gameplay seems smooth but the graphics colours are terrible. The response is decent. If your looking for a cheap monitor purely for playing the odd game on and aren't that bothered if it looks decent, it's cheap enough and will do that job.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Smith

customer_reviews.title: Screen tearing: likely
customer_reviews.text: The cable that came with the monitor connecting to the pc was relatively short, so I ended up getting a replacement. Furthermore, the monitor has horizontal screen tearing at present with the use of Hdmi output to DVI input. Also tried with HDMI-> HDMI. Unless you have a VGA connector for your pc, you're potentially going to experience horizontal screen tears. The Monitor has an "image setup" function, which would allow for adjustments, however it seems non-adjustable with an HDMI connector. It's not the worst fault and really not too noticeable but if you have something particularly visual, it becomes apparent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible monitor-but something else even for a budget monitor
customer_reviews.text: I gave it a go as a budget monitor.straight from the box the colour was proper off and everything on the screen is washed out . I tweaker the monitor setting and as well as adjusting my graphic card colour setting which was okayish to use. But over a matter of few weeks the colour gets bit worse. I can’t stand looking at the screen any more as it hurts my eyes. Personally monitors like this should not even exist. I am therefore returning this and start looking for another one .
customer_reviews.author: Aslam

customer_reviews.title: Super good monitor for non and users and multi monitor
customer_reviews.text: Best budget monitor you can get. I've had one for 2months now, and I've just got my second today. They are easy to set up, supports dvi, HDMI and displayport and comes with all needed cables. As an nvidia gtx 1070 and Intel i7 6700 user these monitors still work perfectly, even though they are AMD. They come packed in styrofoam. The 75 getting option will need to be adjusted to on in nvidia control panel if u don't want just 60. Multi monitors are supported very well. Also if using headphones go to audio settings then select your headphones as the monitor speakers will be default.
customer_reviews.author: Carrick

customer_reviews.title: Nice Monitor but..
customer_reviews.text: I got a stuck pixel within a couple of hours but managed to rub it out. Also I managed to get freesync working on my nvidia graphics card by using driver version 417.71 ;) The colour on this monitor looks incredible you'd think it was HDR
customer_reviews.author: A. K. Steele

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, a dead pixel after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good monitor, the picture works incredibly well connected to my Nvidia 1050ti - its good for gaming and I haven't experienced any issues yet. I have tested it on multiple games from Mortal Kombat, Borderlands 2, CSGO, and Skyrim and so far so good. However, after about two/three weeks I did have one dead pixel... Which was slightly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Dont recommend. Even at the price.
customer_reviews.text: Have spent countless hours since purchase trying to fix colours/saturation/contrast. Even with different ICC profiles and GPU control panel tweaks. She just cant come close to what a gamer needs. Luckily Amazon RMA is on ball. Good price. She looks lovely. But picture is horrid unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Flanagan-Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Second screen for a macbook and also for xbox
customer_reviews.text: And we were pleasantly surprised about the quality Has all the connections you need (HDMI) and very easy to set up so you can get going fast! Just the right size for a typical desk and having that second screen for working on a laptop means more efficient working. Sweet! And it doubles up as a good screen for xbox gaming. Clear on detail, sharp, bright so gaming is good. Worth the relatively low investment.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel T Best - The Best Business

customer_reviews.title: Its i good monitor until it went wrong
customer_reviews.text: I had been using this for gaming mostly and round 10 months it would flicker and make a click sound and go black. this problem started getting worse and worse i contacted amazon and were great with sending me a replacement monitor, but the replacement monitor was even worse, i started it up and after watching a video and i noticed a flicker on the screen i started a game and in the menu of the game the screen just kept going to black, again i contacted amazon and now am getting a refund it was a good monitor while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kirby

customer_reviews.title: good monitor
customer_reviews.text: It is a good monitor and the one I am using now with my gaming computer. The problem is the blue colour is too "low", but this is exactly how it is sold in the specifications (it says it protects the eyes) I guess it is possible to change it tweaking a bit the controls. It has cables / connections for everything (cables included in the box) crt, hdmi.... So it gets the 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Batvid

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Recently was just bought this as a surprise gift on my birthday from my Girlfriend and all I have to say about it is that it's awesome! Coming with all the cables you need, including an Aux cable and HDMI, I have had a fantastic experience playing games such as BF1, DayZ and GTA5, all on ultra settings with excellent contrast and colouring. I know 75hz isn't a big step from my previous 60hz monitor, but I feel I can seriously tell when I join largely populated servers whilst gaming; Screen tearing is at a minimal. For anyone who would like to upgrade monitors but can afford a 1440p, 4K, 144hz montior, then I highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor I have ever had!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful monitor!!! I spent ages looking at loads of different monitors. The main use is gaming and light work. I have found one of the best monitors I have ever got! The picture quality is great. It is very easy to set up and I love the red trim on it. In fact I have enjoyed this monitor so much I am going to get a second one so I can have a two monitor setup!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Buckenham

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor, colours a bit off
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I have the 24in AOC 144mhz and thought this would be ideal 2nd monitor. It's got different colour settings and so when designing, each monitor looks a little bit different. Tried changing the settings to the same on both monitors using the same type of ports but it's still off.
customer_reviews.author: I am Nubz

customer_reviews.title: 16:10 MONITOR
customer_reviews.text: PROS 16:10 Ratio which is great for gaming, using office and scrolling on web pages. A longer monitor than 16:9 monitors, which is the new standard to save costs by using a TV lcd panel. Nice crisp, bright image Excellent value for money VGA Display port and HDMI port CONS For movies you will have a black bar at the bottom. No speakers
customer_reviews.author: J. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: CCTV Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Needed this Monitor for my CCTV system and fitted it ok, very simple to fit, CD was enclosed giving instructions. TBH I wasn't going to buy this at first as all the other known names were sold out, glad I did nothing wrong with this product just an unknown name.
customer_reviews.author: paul thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a second monitor for working from home and I have found it excellent to use. I was particularly pleased that there are leads for each of the 3 ways you can connect it to a computer, plus an audio lead (and the power lead of course). I use the display port lead for my work computer, as the VGA is currently being used for an older monitor, but could swap to VGA if/when the other one packs up. There is also an HDMI port and lead that I can use with both my notebook and my all-in-one pcs if I wanted. Very pleased with it for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Harding

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing step-up from 60hz gaming. The difference is immense. Been using this monitor for over a year and it's really holding up. No issues so far. The display does have issues with displaying shadows in shows but I mainly use it for gaming so I don't have an issue with it.
customer_reviews.author: The Honest Student

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality - No sound
customer_reviews.text: Speakers dont work. Free sync not supported. AMD driver doesnt recongnise it. Screen blurs and 1ms response is clearly a lie. Refresh HZ lower than advertised. Usually I give cheap equipment a chance but not when its broken out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: avoid buying.
customer_reviews.text: Personally I’ve had problems with 2 of these brand new monitors. The first one I purchased I set up and it started constantly flickering and a black screen. Got in touch with AOC (who never responded) and amazon. Amazon sorted me a replacement which took a week to come, plugged that in and experienced the EXACT same issue. Returning as this is not acceptable. Avoid buying this monitor.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Good screen on a dodgy stand
customer_reviews.text: Got this open-box on an Amazon Warehouse deal, though I'd happily have paid Amazon's full price for it. Seems to be a good first monitor. It came with all the cables you could want and a CD (vintage) with drivers and the manual. Menus are easy enough to navigate and my inexpert eye was happy enough with the colour. The provided stand really isn't the best though — it's got VESA mounting screws on the back so I'll probably swap it out for something more adjustable in future.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant gaming monitor at a brilliant price, for what it offers you won’t find much else with specs like this. Used it for a couple months now and had no issues with it, no dead pixels. Obviously as someone else has mentioned the speakers are abysmal but then again who purchased this for the speakers? 😉 so not really an issue
customer_reviews.author: Solomons

customer_reviews.title: basicly perfect
customer_reviews.text: i only have on gripe with this monitor there is one single dead pixel on the screen not enought to warrent a return but it is there only realy notisable if your looking for it but now i know its there when the screen is black wooo hooo here i am haha
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN N.

customer_reviews.title: Great but time consuming.
customer_reviews.text: Nice monitor overall, great size and easy assembly. Anyone who intends on buying this monitor should be aware that it does take quite a large amount of calibration and adjusting to get the picture right. The manual is worth a read to understand what some of the settings do. I'm not sure if it is LED as the blacks aren't as deep as my other LED. Perhaps it's an LCD panel with LED backlighting​.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Bancroft

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this amidst the C virus situation to use whilst I’m working from home, I used it daily for roughly a week, and it done the job perfectly! However I left it turned off over the Easter weekend, and this morning it’s no longer powering on! Have ordered some new fuses as I’m hoping it’s just a faulty fuse🤞
customer_reviews.author: Holly Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Decent gaming monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mainly for the freesync technology - nice clear picture, good brightness and decent viewing angles. It's taken over as my main monitor on a dual screen setup (even though my second LG screen is a fair bit larger) - the picture quality definitely makes up for it!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Good all round monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Product is pretty decent, although black isn't very deep. Has different modes though and I do like the gaming mode which does show more vibrant colours, which is nice. Very fast delivery too, which was awesome and unexpected, considering as I write this review, we are in the middle of a pandemic and most are now working from home and ordering monitors, which was why I bought it. Overall, can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor - But NOT the monitor pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a great monitor, bright clarity and fantastic connectivity, the monitor is NOT as shown in the product images. There is no height adjustment, no screen rotation. (I presume it's a different year's mode, however it's still the same product number) That aside, it's a great value for money screen. VGA/DP/HDMI cables provided.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.text: In order for the monitor to work properly we must connect to the graphics card on our computer and in the screen settings change the resolution to normal, so that it started working in 144hz, 60hz is set by default, so someone who does not know will have a problem with the monitor, I recommend using a DP cable, which looks like on the picture attached to me. Large, transparent monitor, with the possibility of rotating around its axis as well as setting the angle of view and height
customer_reviews.author: gabi

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I can't pretend to give a technical review, but I found this monitor to be pretty easy to set up and with excellent picture quality. The only issue is that the stand is a bit flimsy feeling and any time you knock the desk at all the monitor shakes a lot. However, I don't expect that it will break, it just seems like it could - although if you needed to move it you would want to be very careful about it.
customer_reviews.author: Laz

customer_reviews.title: Nice monitor
customer_reviews.text: I really like this monitor, I use it for PC gaming / general browsing as well as PS4 and Nintendo switch. Not sure what I was expecting from a monitor with built in speakers but the sound isn't really good enough for me so I will be buying some external speakers, Missing height adjustable stand and no USB ports are also negative points. However, for the price this monitor is a win for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Functional but naff.
customer_reviews.text: It's functional, but colour balance is awful, viewing angle sucks and the audio is about on par with a crystal radio set from the 50s. I bought this intending to get two to run in portrait mode, but I wouldn't buy another one of them after working with this one for a while. Just good enough to not go through the hassle of returning, and I'm kind of regretting that.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D. Swan

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with product...
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t have specific or exacting needs for a monitor. Hence I haven’t rated it from a gaming perspective. Saw this at a good price, same brand as used at work. Does the job very well so far.
customer_reviews.author: stuart bailey

customer_reviews.title: 75hz smooth gameplay!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, it does indeed have Freesync, all 3 CABLES included with it (Great because I needed the DP cable) and it runs smooth at 75hz in MMORPG's and Single Player Games, just what I wanted, good price, good quality, for a 21.5 inch monitor it really could not be any better in my eyes. AOC is a good brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kapi Heartlilly

customer_reviews.title: Good monitor.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as a monitor for an Apple TV and it works perfectly. It has a small jack output for the audio so it can be used with just the HDMI lead and no other audio lead, as the sound is derived from the HDMI lead and then can be fed into an external amplifier. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Darby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use for business (writing reports, Excel spreadsheets, etc), and they're perfect. Particularly good is their connectivity, as well as coming with all related cables. Sharp, bright picture. VESA mount. Great price. All-round perfection!
customer_reviews.author: Bahtatboy

customer_reviews.title: Great 1080p budget gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great gaming 1080p monitor, AOC is a very reputable brand, can't go wrong. Also for this price is difficult to find anything with similar specs. Only reason I'm giving four stars is that the monitor came with a dead pixel on the left side of the screen, which was a bit annoying, but overall not a huge problem. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Matteo C.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best picture
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a great deal as the price is encouraging, but unfortunately you get what you paid for. I returned it a week after purchase, the colors weren't the best, the design is ugly and the picture is so grainy. Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.author: ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Although the "Technical Details" claim the screens have 2 x USB 2.0 and 2 x USB 3.0 ports, it has none, just Power, DP, HDMI, D-SUB, Audio Line In and Earphone. One of them has developed a pale patch in the top left-hand corner, but it's still OK to use
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Clark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a budget gamer
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review over a year after I have bought this monitor. As a budget gamer I wanted something better then a standard 60hz monitor but I couldn't find anything for a such a low price until I came across this, 75hz 1ms response time and much better build quality then everything else in the price range. The extra frames it gets makes a huge difference in FPS and Esports games, what a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Sholom Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: amazing I bought one over a year ago and I loved it I used it for school work and xbox gaming then 1/2 months ago I built a gaming pc and got a second and third monitor so I can run a triple monitor setup and I still love them all the only issue is older family members think I am some computer wizard now and have no idea how I can use all 3 monitors at once so in conclusion I would advise this to anyone how wants a cheap and good gaming monitor for less that £200
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor
customer_reviews.text: AOC has always been one of my favourite monitor brands. They always provide excellent quality without taking hundreds from your wallet. The picture quality and brightness are definitely up to scratch and the response rate is definitely good enough for gaming. If anyones looking for their first monitor or even looking to add to a collection I say do it
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Decent value for money but it isn't very good with black levels (pitch black looks like dark grey) which is noticeable when watching programs or playing games with the light off
customer_reviews.author: A. Tsang

customer_reviews.title: Faulty but brilliant when its working
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully for gaming and content creation until the screen goes all fuzzy, see image. Looks like a common issue by the amount of complaints in here which is a shame as when its working this monitor is superb for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and great clear screen
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this monitor , I am working at home and it had been perfect for every day use .
customer_reviews.author: alex bowen

customer_reviews.title: Great screen for the price
customer_reviews.text: 144 hz freesync that comes with one of each cable. Also added bonus is the two side usb that were a nice surprise. The sound is terrible however, to the point inwhich I wonder why they even have speakers on it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Matt from IT

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Great Budget Monitor, nice picture quality for the price and have several colour mode for a different scenario.. I didn't see a huge difference for that 1ms response speed in contrast with my 5ms one, however it's 80 quid monitor and I really don't have much to complain..
customer_reviews.author: Yinhao He

customer_reviews.title: Not goof
customer_reviews.text: Aoc are not the best, work till warrantyruns out then develops problems and dcreen cracks
customer_reviews.author: Gary O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Too bright
customer_reviews.text: solidly built, good size monitor. Biggest drawback though is that its too bright and even scouring the internet and trying custom changes to the config to reduce it without losing quality, doesn't work. Would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: nic

customer_reviews.title: Pro's outweigh the Con's
customer_reviews.text: Great response time, Freesync and up to 75hz, if you have a Radeon graphics card then you can take advantage of the Freesync feature this monitor comes with, but even if you do not it is still a great monitor. The built in speakers are not the best but I have heard worse, I usually use headphones anyway. This for the price is a good deal especially if you are on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Was worried after reading some reviews, but its the best purchase i've made
customer_reviews.text: fantastic image quality, no screen tearing. Had to change a couple settings to use the 75hz refresh rate, and still don't know how to make gsync compatible with the free sync but i'll get there. Definetely worth the price, you get more than what you pay for. Only thing is, the stand is not great. So i'd recommend getting your own or mounting it to a dual stand
customer_reviews.author: Ayman

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Laptop speakers
customer_reviews.text: Good quality screen with good resolution. However on plugging into laptop sound disappeared, swapping leads showed sound could be achieved with VGA cable, however need to use laptop without a VGA connection. Also instructions on CD, but I do not have CD reader. Online manual did not help resolve sound interference, so returning unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No USB ports
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised that the monitor does not have USB as the features stated (Number of USB 2.0 Ports 2 Number of USB 3.0 Ports 2) this is quite deceiving. Also the Watt advertised stated 20 but on the Monitor the label shows 24Watt. I may return this because I need additional port for USB
customer_reviews.author: Albert-fowora

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this purchase - great quality monitor for a very good price, it does the job for gaming, and has plenty of settings to adjust the picture to exactly what you want.
customer_reviews.author: E Appleton

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level monitor
customer_reviews.text: Using this for a kids first pc gaming monitor and for the price it’s a great entry level monitor. I have no complaints about the colour/contrast and no issues with pixels or backlight bleed, 1ms response time and 75hz with FreeSync for under £100 is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley F

customer_reviews.title: Really love it.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up, has a wide variety of functions. I bought this to replace an older LG screen that had broken during the power cut. I'd bought several monitors since then but all of them had washed out colours in comparison. This one has extremely deep colours and is amazing for gaming. Really can't complain at all.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer.

customer_reviews.title: Good All-Rounder
customer_reviews.text: Excellent picture quality, looks very sleek and nice, only one fault: power connector on the back is a bit loose. Given power leads for all plug types (US/UK/Aus/etc), and given all necessary cables (HDMI/DP/etc). Very good, and worth a buy.
customer_reviews.author: Generic Customer Name

customer_reviews.title: Blank screen
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on the 11th August 2018 and in the last 2 month's the screen has been going blank and turning off yet still able to talk through the game but when the monitor turns off it makes the fan in the desktop make a louder sound and unless the desktop gets turned off the fan will continue making the noise but then when turned back on the screen will work for a little while before turning back off and starting the fan off again
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: No speakers but other than that nice screen
customer_reviews.text: Great screen, and came with all the cables you might need. I haven't figured out why it has an audio in port and audio cable, but doesn't seem to have any speakers? Maybe its to feed through to the headphones port, but I haven't tried it yet so if that's an issue for you I would investigate more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality of this product
customer_reviews.text: Birthday present for 15 year old son he is into gaming and said it was a great product he was the one that added it to his wish list. The monitor meet all of his expectations a quality product. Also, posting was very efficient Amazon delivered on a Sunday
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Brown

customer_reviews.title: Read before you buy
customer_reviews.text: I just received my monitor and it definitely wasn't new the box had clearly been opened and re sealed using regular tape the card bits weren't even folded in, however the monitor does work just fine no scratches no dead pixels and it's refresh rate is great it also came with all the necessary cables including hdmi and display it even included some audio wires.
customer_reviews.author: Ned

customer_reviews.title: Resealed and dead pixel
customer_reviews.text: Looks good although had to return one due to dead pixels and then got the replacement both seals had been broken and then resealed with another AOC seal but with a larger font to desguise it
customer_reviews.author: Ceri

customer_reviews.title: Nice, clear
customer_reviews.text: Nice, clear, sharp picture. Would give 5 stars but the speakers are a waste of time as they are poor quality, you won't want to use them. Would be better if they left the speakers off it and made it a little cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor for the price. I’ve only given 4 stars because the setup was a bit tricky, but overall very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Good specs, nice customisation and variety of ports.
customer_reviews.text: This screen works without error when gaming, watching or just browsing, the drivers installed offer a large amount of customisation, for things like brightness, contrast, aspect ratio and more. Overall, I would recommend this moniter as a cheaper, but equally good quality option.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kydd

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant
customer_reviews.text: So far seems to be alright as a monitor, screen is clear and bright, no read pixels! Can adjust tilt on stand, has spare hdmi, dvi cables in box! Overall seems like a good monitor for the price
customer_reviews.author: Nyferia

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant quality monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic screen quality for gaming and anything else. My Eldest Son has 144hz but would happily have this as a secondary or main monitor after seeing his younger Brother using this. Hoping to buy a couple more in the coming months.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Moore

customer_reviews.title: Misleading advertising
customer_reviews.text: Technical Details the description telling about four USB ports which not exist. The pictures provided on the product description showing that the stand is we function to move in and monitor vertically horizontally my stand is totally different. Monitor quality is quite good for the price but it is total misleading advertising, for the first time, I am disappointed with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dariusz

customer_reviews.title: Missing cable
customer_reviews.text: Was dissappointed that DVI D dual cable was missing in the box, had to order it separately and spend extra even though manufactures website states it is included in the package. For that reason 4 stars Also price originally shown was different from the one was charged on my card. All in all, my son thinks it is the best gaming monitor at £ 204 we paid
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cracking mid size monitor
customer_reviews.text: Very little to dislike with these beauties (I bought 2) very controllable. Easy to mount on monitor arms and with reasonable connectivity. No pixel issues.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitors, wait for a price drop
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these 24" beauties when they dropped to £109 thinking that's an amazing price, a couple of hours later they shot back up to £140. They're great and totally worth every penny, especially at a price drop! I've mounted these on a vesa mount and it completes my setup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to use with my Xbox when streaming or ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to use with my Xbox when streaming or just using it as a monitor for my laptop as a second screen. The picture is clear and precise.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Decent monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace a TV that was being used as a monitor, the response time is great and it has served me well since the purchase. Please be aware that some websites have noted this as having speakers, it actually has a 3.5mm jack in it so if you have sound provided by the graphics card through the HDMI or Display-port then you can just plug in some speakers or headphones into the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Superb value
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant monitor. Great picture quality at an affordable price. Only tiny drawback is it is not physically adjustable in any way - ie you cannot move it up or down or tilt it. Although that doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Shinyrock300

customer_reviews.title: Great I think I want another one.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this monitor as it has a minimalist design and is of a perfect size, image quality is as expected with a good refresh rate. That means that I will be getting myself another one in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Burton

customer_reviews.title: General Review - 2019/10/18
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to recommendation for anyone's first gaming monitor. The price to performance is almost unmatched from what I had researched before I bought it. You do need to use a display port cable to reach the 75hz at 1080p and if I recall correctly, this does not come with one. But the monitor itself? AWESOME.
customer_reviews.author: T-Biscuit

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: Screen is great for gaming. Very nice screen quality as well as colour balance. It does what it says on the tin!
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixels
customer_reviews.text: My only problems with this monitor is that it gets dead pixels and that the software is hard to install. The 75hrz is great for a small step up.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer!
customer_reviews.text: My 14yr old son is very happy with his PC Monitor. It is currently being used for his Xbox one, easy to set up & picture quality is good. We also received communication from the actual supplier which was nice & it arrived a day earlier then expected!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah-Jane

customer_reviews.title: Worth while investment
customer_reviews.text: No screen tearing and 144 fps - amazing. The built in speakers are real bad, but you're not buying it for those reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Luke A.

customer_reviews.title: Great 144hz screen
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant 144hz screen! Make sure you set your resolution to 144hz otherwise you don't actually get 144hz refresh. The monitor has plenty of outputs and a premium finish to the bezel around the screen. Speakers are as you would expect for monitor speakers but not a problem if you solely use headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: This desktop screen is of ok quality if considered price. I have bought Dell screen earlier with the same price but was great in all aspects. Finally decided to return this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ashu

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: 27" its enough for playing and every day use ,good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrzej

customer_reviews.title: really good monitor
customer_reviews.text: originally bought this to use for gaming on my xbox and then i later upgraded to pc gaming, it is suitable for xbox gaming but i wouldn't recommend 75hz for pc gaming, still a fantastic second monitor however.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, but miss-advertised?
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is a good monitor to get. However the only issue for me, and I seen other people complain about it is that the refresh rate is not as advertised. It's advertised as 75Hz yet my softwares say it's 60Hz. Personally I don't really mind but it's not what it advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Mateusz B.

customer_reviews.title: Useless and disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Can’t put into words how frustrating and terrible this product is. Has severe issue with dead pixels, coming out around a month after use and now, after returning, they’re back and this time after the return deadline. Totally disappointed and feel robbed to be frank
customer_reviews.author: gshr

customer_reviews.title: My 9 year old loves this
customer_reviews.text: My son plays his Xbox on this currently and he lives it but unfortunately the plug makes a funny noice and if it is moved it turns off and you have to jiggle the plug to turn on so must be a short.such a shame because it's a gr8 monitor
customer_reviews.author: rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Smart purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase and second time bought the same. Good value gaming monitor and we’re fussy!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Whiberley

product_meta.title: AOC G2460VQ6 24" Widescreen TN LED Black gaming Monitor 75Hz (1920x1080/1ms/VGA/HMDI/DisplayPort) Built in Speakers, AMD FreeSync
product_meta.description:
Size Name:75Hz| Style Name:24 inch HD| Pattern Name:SingleAOC Gaming G2460VQ6 - LED monitor - 24" - 1920 x 1080 - 250 cd/m2 - 1000:1 - 1 ms - HDMI, DVI-D, VGA, DisplayPort - speakers - black. No stuttering, no tearing, just gaming.Featuring AMD FreeSync technology to eliminate tearing, stuttering and input lag, the 24-inch AOC G2460VQ6 also boasts a 1ms response time, a 75Hz refresh rate, and the innovative Anti-Blue Light technology, which reduces eye fatigue for a more comfortable viewing.

BOX CONTAINS
Monitor and user manual, VGA cable 1,8 m / HDMI cable 1,8 m / Displayport Cable 1,8 m / Audio Cable 1,8 m / Power Cable C7 1.8 m
feature_bullets: Brightness: 250 (typ) cd/m (typ) , Screen Format: 16:9, Monitor Size: 24"
Contrast Ratio Dynamic: 200,000,000:1 (DCR), Blue Light Technology, Contrast Ratio Typical: 1000:1
tilt and vesa mountable solution 100 x 100

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,187 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
